MANEY & SON LIMITED HUDSON ROAD LEEDS LSg 7DL PREFACE It is a pleasant duty to welcome several new contributors, and a sad one to note the retirement of the following: Mr Pat Harkins (1975— 77), Dr Michael R. Kelley (1975-77), Professor Artem Lozynsky ( 1 975 — 76) , Mrs Judy McQueen (1975—77), Dr James H. Mitchell (1974-77), Dr Michael Parkinson (1970-76), Dr Philip Roberts ( 1 975 — 76) , Mr Ray Scrivens (1977), Professor Charles W. Smith (1976—77), Professor Gregory S. Sojka (1977), Mrs Juliette Stevens ( 1 975 — 77) 5 Dr James D. Welch (1974-75), Dr William C. Wright (1969—77). It is impossible adequately to thank them or the rest of the team, who maintain not only a high standard of accuracy and punctuality but also a remarkable level of cheerfulness. The Editor’s grateful thanks go also to the American and U.K. Editors, the Editorial Assistants (especially Miss Penelope Cowell, who now leaves her post after much careful hard work on three volumes), the Academic Advisers, the staff of the Cambridge Uni¬ versity Library (especially Mrs C. J. Whitford) and Mrs R. M. Smith. The support and encouragement of the officers and Committee of the MHRA is much appreciated. As always, the work of Messrs W. S. Maney & Son has been extraordinarily good. Michael Smith MARY ELIZABETH COX Mary Elizabeth Cox, who died on 6 January 1979, had been a contributor to the Annual Bibliography since 1967; her contribution to volume 52 was her last. She was a most reliable and meticulous worker, and her dedication to the Bibliography was maintained even in her final illness. The Editors wish to record their appreciation of her service and extend their sympathy to her family. J. B. M„ M. J. DeM., M. E. S. U. K. to maintain regular coverage of the periodicals listed below, no undertaking is given that every journal listed has been fully reported. Issues which have not been available to contributors during the report year are covered as soon as possible thereafter. Articles may also be reported from periodicals not included in this list, for example when a magazine publishes a special literary number. In such cases the place of publication is given in each entry for that periodical. The editors will be glad to hear of errors and omissions, and of new journals requiring coverage. In many cases journals are referred to in this volume by their main titles alone (e.g. Agora, Centrum), without this title being shown separately below as an abbreviation.
